SENT.plain: In the majority of cases of overt acute myeloid leukemia (AML), there is no knowledge about a preleukemic phase of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)
A few recent case-control studies suggest an association between MDS and several occupations
We report a unique case of MDS/AML related to the patient's work condition with numerous cytostatic agents
The karyotype revealed a spectrum of genetic rearrangements identified by conventional cytogenetics, fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) and spectral karyotyping (SKY)
We suggest that amplification of chromosomal material may play a greater role in leukemogenesis than has been recognized previously
